name: Junior to Mid
summary: Mid level developers should be proficient in the technical systems that they are working on. They should be aware and guided by the wider context of their work. They should take responsibility for their work and own their personal development. They should be working as part of a team to achieve the shared goals of the team.

competencies.summary: Is responsible for and maintains their local development environment
Uses version control to manage development workflow
examples: Git specific example: clone, branch, add, commit, push, rebase

competencies.summary: Uses a programming language to make something
Writes automated unit and end to end tests for features
Fixes or updates tests when changing existing code
Learns and improves independently
Uses third party code and shared libraries to reuse code
Regularly fixes security issues raised by others/automation in own code
Regularly and independently debugs and fixes issues in their own code
Gets involved in fixing production issues
Uses continuous delivery or build pipelines for automation
Uses monitoring (not implement monitoring)
examples: Pingdom, grafana

competencies.summary: Reasons about technical trade-offs
examples: Weighs up the benefits of making code more abstract vs specific

competencies.summary: Regularly documents code through appropriate methods
examples: READMEs
Commit messages
Line comments

competencies.summary: Provides feedback on peer’s work
examples: Reviews pull requests and gives actionable empathetic feedback

competencies.summary: Writes clear tickets, issues and bug reports that contain the necessary amount of detail to be easily picked up by other developers
Takes ownership of personal development
Receives feedback and acts upon it
Regularly gives timely actionable feedback to colleagues
Works on the most important task
examples: Picks the story from the top of a prioritised backlog rather than picking the one that most interests them
Does not get side-tracked by unnecessary details - “I don’t like these tests so I’m going to re-wite them as part of this ticket”

competencies.summary: Uses user research or data to inform decisions
examples: Attends customer based user research for a feature being worked on
Sets up some guerilla testing with developers for a new bit of tooling

competencies.summary: Leads on getting well defined tasks from concept to production
Regularly collaborates with team members from other disciplines to deliver features
Regularly contributes openly to team meetings and encourages others to do so
Regularly communicates the status of work
Asks for help or clarification on tasks when required
Suggests process improvements
examples: Asks for stand-ups to help team communication
Suggests using Github Issues to track untracked technical work

competencies.summary: Represents the views of self and peers to leaders, stakeholders or product owners
Understands how they contribute to the businesses goals
examples: Can explain how what they do affects the wider business - such as “I work on code that enables FT.com customers to log in”

competencies.summary: Has knowledge of at least one other area of the FT outside technology
examples: Can articulate the editorial workflow
Knows what’s important to finance

competencies.summary: Acts with integrity, honesty and accountability
Positively contributes to an inclusive team culture
examples: Reminds others that a team members may have child care duties
Draws people working remotely into planning conversations
Tactfully calls out exclusive or alienating behaviors from others
Organises a leaving collection for a colleague
Makes a round of tea for the team
Documents team norms to help new starters
Checks in with team members who appear stressed
